Locating the Initialization Files

Initialization files have different locations on different Windows platforms. On NT, C:\interoffice is the pathPrefix. On 2000 and XP, the pathPrefix is C:\Documents and Settings.

  • ClientLicenses.st lists is located at pathPrefix\All Users\Application Data\Borland\StarTeam\ClientLicenses.st. This file is installed by StarTeam Runtime and the application clients. If the ClientLicenses.st file is missing, you are asked to register the product.

  • ConnectionManager.ini (for starting the application) is located at pathPrefix\All Users\Application Data\Borland\StarTeam\ConnectionManager.ini. This file is installed by StarTeam Runtime and the application clients. If the ConnectionManager.ini file is missing or corrupted, the application asks if you want it recreated. Reinstallation can also recreate the missing file. See Using ConnectionManager.ini.

  • The starteam-servers.xml (formerly ServerList.st) File lists the server configurations for which you have created server descriptions. It is located at pathPrefix\user\Application Data\Borland\StarTeam\ServerList. This file is installed by StarTeam Runtime and the application clients. ServerList.st is converted to starteam-servers.xml when you start the Windows client for the first time. If you do not have a ServerList.st file, a new, empty starteam-servers.xml is created. See Using starteam-servers.xml.

  • The starteam-client-options.xml (formerly StarTeam.ini) file is located at pathPrefix\user\ Application Data\Borland\StarTeam\starteam-client-options.xml. This file is installed by StarTeam Runtime and the application clients. This file lists your personal option settings and any alternate working folders you have set up via the application. If this file is missing, the application automatically recreates it without consulting you. However, the recreated file contains only the default settings for Personal Options and no alternate working folder information. If the starteam-client-options.xml file is corrupted, you can delete it, but it might be possible to edit it. You may want to back up your starteam-client-options.xml or put it under version control. See Using starteam-client-options.xml.

    • You can tell that the starteam-client-options.xml file is missing or corrupted when:

    • Your Personal Options are no longer correct.

    • Changes you made to Personal Options disappear when you restart the application.

    • Files do not change even though you have checked them out (because they have been copied to the wrong working folders).

    • The application indicates that old files are missing and does not see new files (because it looks for them in the wrong place).

    See Using starteam-client-options.xml.

  • The Starteam-Server-Configs.xml file, which is used for server session information, is located at serverinstallationFolder\Starteam-Server-Configs.xml.
